ms_copies_parts: Naples, Conservatorio. Two copies: 22.5.2, and 22.5.6. 'Quartetto no. 1...'
Paris, Conservatoire, a parcel of copies
sources.first_edition: (1778?), Paris, Sieber (Op. 27), no. 1 of Sei quartetti concertanti per due violini alto e violoncello composti da Luigi Boccherini, compositore e virtuoso di camera di S.A.R. Don Luigi Infante d'Ispagna. op. 27. Prix 9. à Paris, chez le Sr Sieber musicien rue St Honoré, vis à vis l'Hôtel d'Aligre Ancien Grand Conseil où l'on trouve plusieurs nouveaux ouvrages. A.P.D.R. Plate no. 436. Some later copies (c. 1791) have the address ... Hôtel d'Aligre chez l'Apothicaire n°85. A.P.D.R.
later_editions: (c. 1785?), Amsterdam, Hummel (Op. 11), no. 1 of Six quatuors concertants à deux violons, alto et basse composés par Luigi Boccherini oeuvre XI. Chez J. J. Hummel, à Berlin avec privilège du Roi, à Amsterdam au Grand Magazin de Musique et aux adresses ordinaires. Prix F. 5. Plate no. 170.
arrangements: Of the third movement for flute or violin, by an unknown musician, published c. 1785 in L. Lavenu's Musical Journal or Pocket Companion containing a great variety of Opera dances Single airs ... arrang'd for the flute or violin. London. Printed and Sold by L. Lavenu ... (vol. 2, p. 557) [Copy: London, British Museum].

entries.notes: Op. 24 no. 4 of 1776-1778 ('opera grande') in Boccherini's autograph catalogue

continues_from_previous.notes: The page begins with general information about STRING QUARTERS (TWO VIOLINS, VIOLA AND 'CELLO) including autograph MS, MS copies, first edition, later edition, and arrangement details that appear to be general catalog information rather than specific to entry 192.

partial_notes: Entry 192 appears to be incomplete as only the first movement is shown with 'Moderato' tempo marking. The incipit shows musical notation in C time signature.
